intro: Wiborgia parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved wiborgia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are small, lance-shaped, and covered in a fine layer of hair, which helps reduce water loss in its harsh native climate. Wiborgia parvifolia is often found in meadows and on slopes, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its ecosystem.
